issue.title: segmentation fault on gui startup
issue.body:
I've been running bitcoin-qt built from the git master branch recently and have seen it crash a few times. Unfortunately I got out of the habit of running it in a debugger so wasn't able to post a useful bug report. This time however it was running in gdb, so I captured stack traces.

I built against commit 2e8f9dc2bbb1200218feaf80344d35dca1cd6b25. I hope this is helpful. I realize the commit is a few weeks old now, but I figured it might be worth posting anyway.

    Thread 1 "bitcoin-qt" received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.

`Help > About Qt` tells me "This program uses Qt version 5.7.1."

Also:

    $ dpkg -l qtbase5-dev | grep amd
    ii  qtbase5-dev:amd64                   5.7.1+dfsg-3+b1        amd64                  Qt 5 base development files

I'd guess that over 90% of the time I try to run bitcoin-qt it doesn't crash. Crashes are rare, but I've been seeing them for years on and off on various different computers.

What's the recommended Qt version to use? I'm guessing most users don't see these semi regular crashes or there'd be more effort to diagnose it.
Thanks @MarcoFalke. I thought it looked familiar. I'll close this one and comment in #9683.
